DataElement.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire-4 (PHQ-4) 1 Last 2 Weeks How Often Bothered by Feeling Nervous Anxious or on Edge Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often during the past two weeks they have been bothered by feeling nervous, anxious or on edge, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire-4 Past 2 Weeks How Often Bothered by Problems Feeling Nervous, Anxious or on Edge Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An ultra-brief self-report questionnaire that consists of a 2-item depression scale that uses the first 2 questions from the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) and a 2-item anxiety scale that uses the first two questions from the Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item scale (GAD-7)._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about how often an individual is or was bothered by problems._A question about whether an individual feels or felt nervous, anxious or on edge._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An ultra-brief self-report questionnaire that consists of a 2-item depression scale that uses the first 2 questions from the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) and a 2-item anxiety scale that uses the first two questions from the Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item scale (GAD-7).

Concepts.definition: An ultra-brief self-report questionnaire that consists of a 2-item depression scale that uses the first 2 questions from the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) and a 2-item anxiety scale that uses the first two questions from the Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-item scale (GAD-7).

Concepts.longName: Feeling Nervous, Anxious or on Edge

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
